question.title: Can ignite-spring module be disabled (removed/moved to optional) somehow when deploying the Ignite Binary Distribution
question.body:
As noted in the ignite docs here the ignite-spring module is enabled by default along with core, control-utility & indexing. I gather the reason this module is enabled by default is due to the support for XML-based configuration.

If so, the question is do we really need the entire ignite-spring module along with all its spring dependencies just for the ability to specify config in XML?

Is there a way to deploy the binary distribution using the second Programmatic Configuration option as noted in the docs by removing/disabling the ignite-spring module?

I ask because we get CVEs all the time in spring & with the release cadence of ignite one is forced to tweak things even though these CVEs are not necessarily applicable a lot of times (if I understood this right that is).

So if there is a way to decouple spring dependency for the binary distribution it would be nice (not that one should still be able to run client instances as spring applications that read/write to the server instance deployed with the binary distro which I assume should not be a problem if these dependencies are only meant for XML config).

answers.body: You can use Ignite in embedded mode. You just need to create a Java process and run Ignition.start(), though the simplest way is probably to use Spring Boot.

79617465.body: Ignite 2 supports embedded mode. Ignite 3 does not require a licence file.

The docs for [embedded mode[(ignite.apache.org/docs/ignite3/latest/quick-start/…) mentions, "To start a Ignite 3 cluster, you need to provide a license together with the cluster configuration in the clusterConfiguration parameter.". Do you know if embedded mode is a premium feature under gridgain license?

Thanks @Stephen Darlington I didn't know there is an embedded mode now...it was always possible to start ignite in server mode from even a spring application. Anyways I see this mode is available only with 3.0. We are still in 2.x. I guess upgrade the only way out..
